metadata.title: CVE-2024-41089 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/nouveau/dispnv04: fix null pointer dereference in nv17_tv_get_hd_modesIn nv17_tv_get_hd_modes(), the return value of drm_mode_duplicate() isassigned to mode, which will lead to a possible NULL pointer dereferenceon failure of drm_mode_duplicate(). The same applies to drm_cvt_mode().Add a check to avoid null pointer dereference.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-261.295').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1139.149').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1176.191').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1175.188~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1183.198~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1107.114').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1168.185~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1137.148~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
